data.title: Joker, Deadpool and Wolverine, Gladiator, and Moana lead a stellar 2024 lineup of 10 hot sequels
data.meta_description: Theatres have been bombarded by sequels, from Inside Out 2 to The First Omen, and Hollywood still has many more lined up.
data.text:
Theatres have been bombarded by sequels, from Inside Out 2 to The First Omen, and Hollywood still has many more lined up.

Films like Joker 2 and Beetlejuice Beetlejuice are set for a 2024 release, while sequels for The Devil Wears Prada and Practical Magic are in the early stages of development.

Here's a look at some of the biggest sequels still to come.

It feels like Hollywood has an endless supply of film sequels, and this year, cinemas were flooded with them (which is not too different from previous years). Numerous sequels have already been shown in theatres, and there are more to come.

Some of the sequels that have already been released this year include Inside Out 2, The First Omen, Furiosa, Dune Part Two, Mean Girls (remake), Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes, A Quiet Place: Day One, Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire, Road House (remake), The Fall Guy (remake), Maxxxine, Kung Fu Panda 4, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire, Bad Boys: Ride or Die, Despicable Me 4, Beverly Hills Cop: Axel F and more.

Some sequels for well-known films that have been announced are in early development.

A sequel to The Devil Wears Prada is under production at Disney. According to The Guardian, the new film "follows Miranda Priestly, the withering fashion mag editor played by Meryl Streep, as she navigates the decline of traditional print publication in the digital space."

A sequel to the 1998 film Practical Magic, starring Sandra Bullock and Nicole Kidman, has also been announced. The upcoming film is based on Alice Hoffman's novel The Book of Magic.

A new Karate Kid film, starring Jackie Chan and Ralph Macchio and produced by Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith, is set to be released next year.

Both Toy Story and Shrek are set to have their fifth instalments released in the coming years. The main cast members (Tom Hanks and Tim Allen for Toy Story and Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, and Cameron Diaz for Shrek) for each film are set to return.

Here are some sequels and remakes that are still coming in 2024.

Deadpool and Wolverine

The third instalment of the merc with a mouth's franchise, Deadpool and Wolverine, sees Ryan Reynolds reprise his iconic role, with Hugh Jackman making a return to his once-retired superhero character.

Film description: "Wolverine is recovering from his injuries when he crosses paths with the loudmouth Deadpool. They team up to defeat a common enemy."

Release date: 26 July

Joker: Folie à Deux

The sequel to the wildly successful 2019 comic-book film Joker sees Joaquin Phoenix reprise his leading role with Lady Gaga by his side.

Film description: "Failed comedian Arthur Fleck meets the love of his life, Harley Quinn, while incarcerated at Arkham State Hospital. Upon his release, the two of them embark on a doomed romantic misadventure."

Release date: 4 October

Moana 2

Auli'i Cravalho and Dwayne Johnson return for Disney's Moana 2, playing the eponymous character and Maui, respectively.

Film description: "After receiving an unexpected call from her wayfinding ancestors, Moana must journey to the far seas of Oceania and into dangerous, long-lost waters for an adventure unlike anything she's ever faced."

Release date: 27 November

Gladiator 2

Russell Crowe starred in the original Gladiator film in 2000. Paul Mescal, Denzel Washington, Pedro Pascal and Joseph Quinn star in the upcoming sequel.

Film description: "After his home is conquered by the tyrannical emperors who now lead Rome, Lucius is forced to enter the Colosseum and must look to his past to find strength to return the glory of Rome to its people."

Release date: 22 November

Venom: The Last Dance

The third and possibly final instalment to the Venom film franchise sees Tom Hardy reprise his role as Eddie Brock.

Film description: "Eddie and Venom are on the run. Hunted by both of their worlds and with the net closing in, the duo is forced into a devastating decision that will bring the curtains down on Venom and Eddie's last dance."

Release date: 25 October

Beetlejuice Beetlejuice

The sequel to Beetlejuice comes 36 years after the original film. Michael Keaton, Winona Ryder, Catherine O'Hara, Monica Bellucci, Jenna Ortega and Willem Dafoe are set to feature in the new film.

Film description: "Still haunted by Beetlejuice, Lydia's life is turned upside down when her rebellious teenage daughter, Astrid, discovers the mysterious model of the town in the attic and the portal to the Afterlife is accidentally opened."

Release date: 6 September

Mufasa: The Lion King

Moonlight (2016) creator Barry Jenkins directs the new Lion King 3D animation film, which focuses on Mufasa. The voice cast includes John Kani, Seth Rogen, Donald Glover, Mads Mikkelsen, Blue Ivy Carter, Beyoncé Knowles-Carter and more.

Film description: "Told in flashbacks, the story introduces Mufasa as an orphaned cub, lost and alone, until he meets a sympathetic lion named Taka - the heir to a royal bloodline."

Release date: 20 December

Twisters

The Glen Powell and Daisy Edgar-Jones film Twisters is a sequel to the 1996 film of the same name.

Film description: " As storm season intensifies, terrifying phenomena never seen before are unleashed, and Kate, Tyler and their competing teams find themselves squarely in the paths of multiple storm systems converging over central Oklahoma in the fight of their lives."

Release date: 19 July

Smile 2

With a relatively low budget, the horror film Smile proved to be a surprise hit and financial success. The sequel stars Naomi Scott and Rosemarie DeWitt.

Film description: "About to embark on a new world tour, global pop sensation Skye Riley (Naomi Scott) begins experiencing increasingly terrifying and inexplicable events."

Release date: 18 October

Sonic the Hedgehog 3

The blue running hedgehog returns once again to the big screen with a film starring James Marsden, Idris Elba, Jim Carrey and Keanu Reeves.

Film description: "Sonic, the blurriest hedgehog on Earth, and his loyal teammates, the ingenious Tails and the powerhouse Knuckles, are Green Hills' coolest heroes. But their peace is shattered by the arrival of a villainous quartet with a shared grudge."

Release date: 20 December
